input: <web-search mcp-server="ydc-server">Find current information about: landing page strategy gallery pricing table responsive design patterns 2026</web-search>
output:
Based on the search results, here are the current trends and best practices for landing page strategy, gallery layouts, and pricing tables in 2026:

## Landing Page Design Trends for 2026

Key trends identified from recent industry resources:

1. **Minimalist and Clean Designs** - Focus on clarity and reduced cognitive load
2. **Interactive Elements** - Dynamic content that engages users without overwhelming them
3. **AI-Powered Personalization** - Adaptive content based on user behavior
4. **Micro-interactions** - Subtle animations that provide feedback and enhance UX
5. **Bold Typography** - Large, readable fonts as design focal points
6. **Dark Mode Options** - Increasingly expected across landing pages
7. **Video Backgrounds** - Strategic use of motion to capture attention
8. **Social Proof Integration** - Testimonials, reviews, and trust badges prominently displayed
9. **Speed Optimization** - Fast loading times as a critical conversion factor
10. **Mobile-First Design** - Responsive patterns that prioritize mobile experience

## Pricing Table Best Practices

Modern pricing table strategies include:

- **Highlight Recommended Plans** - Use visual cues (badges, colors, sizing) to guide users
- **Clear Feature Differentiation** - Make tier differences immediately obvious
- **Responsive Card Layouts** - Stack vertically on mobile, display horizontally on desktop
- **Toggle Options** - Monthly/annual switches with savings indicators
- **CTA Prominence** - Clear, contrasting call-to-action buttons
- **Transparent Pricing** - No hidden costs or confusing terms
- **Social Proof** - Add "Most Popular" or "Best Value" labels
- **Comparison Features** - Easy side-by-side feature comparison
- **Flexible Grid Systems** - CSS Grid and Flexbox for adaptive layouts

## Responsive Gallery Patterns

Current responsive gallery approaches:

- **CSS Grid Layouts** - Modern, flexible grid systems that adapt to screen sizes
- **Masonry Layouts** - Pinterest-style layouts for varied image sizes
- **Flexbox Galleries** - Responsive image galleries with flexible wrapping
- **Card-Based Designs** - Consistent card components for gallery items
- **Lazy Loading** - Performance optimization for image-heavy galleries
- **Lightbox Integration** - Modal overlays for detailed image viewing
- **Aspect Ratio Control** - Maintain image proportions across breakpoints
- **Gap and Spacing** - Consistent spacing using CSS gap property

## Implementation Technologies

- **Tailwind CSS** - Popular utility-first framework for rapid development
- **CSS Grid & Flexbox** - Native CSS for responsive layouts
- **Design Tokens** - Systematic approach to maintaining consistency
- **Component Libraries** - Reusable patterns for faster development

Sources:
- [10 SaaS Landing Page Trends for 2026 (with Real Examples) - SaaSFrame](https://www.saasframe.io/blog/10-saas-landing-page-trends-for-2026-with-real-examples)
- [Landing Page Design Trends by Industry (2026 Guide) | involve.me](https://www.involve.me/blog/landing-page-design-trends)
- [Top Landing Page Design Trends for B2B SaaS in 2026 - SaaS Hero](https://www.saashero.net/content/top-landing-page-design-trends/)
- [12 SaaS Pricing Page Best Practices with Examples in 2026](https://www.designstudiouiux.com/blog/saas-pricing-page-design-best-practices/)
- [Pricing Table Best Practices For Every Product and Service](https://htmlburger.com/blog/pricing-table-best-practices/)
- [Frontend Design Patterns That Actually Work in 2026](https://www.netguru.com/blog/frontend-design-patterns)
- [30 CSS Image Gallery Examples & Templates 2026](https://uicookies.com/css-image-galleries/)
- [Tailwind CSS Best Practices 2025-2026: Design Tokens, Typography](https://www.frontendtools.tech/blog/tailwind-css-best-practices-design-system-patterns)

input: <web-search mcp-server="ydc-server">Find current information about: document image augmentation OCR text similarity 2024</web-search>
output:
Based on the search results, here's current information about document image augmentation for OCR text similarity:

## Key Findings from 2024-2025 Research

**Recent Pipeline Developments:**
- **PreP-OCR** (2025): A complete pipeline for document image restoration and OCR that addresses preprocessing challenges before text recognition
- Research shows that proper image preprocessing and augmentation significantly impacts OCR accuracy

**Data Augmentation Techniques:**
Several sources highlight effective augmentation strategies for OCR:
- Geometric transformations (rotation, scaling, perspective warping)
- Noise injection and blur effects
- Brightness/contrast adjustments
- Document-specific distortions (wrinkles, folds, shadows)

**State-of-the-Art Models (2025):**
- Multiple open-source OCR models are now available with benchmarks comparing accuracy and cost
- Deep learning-based approaches have become standard, with automated parallel data augmentation for low-resource scenarios
- Multimodal vision models are increasingly being applied to OCR tasks

**Practical Applications:**
- Printed document layout analysis combined with OCR has shown improved results
- Scene text understanding now incorporates OCR token and word alignment for better accuracy
- Advanced image preprocessing techniques are critical for improving OCR accuracy in production systems

**Key Insight:**
The field has shifted toward end-to-end pipelines that integrate image restoration, augmentation, and OCR in a unified framework, with particular emphasis on handling degraded or challenging document conditions through sophisticated preprocessing and augmentation strategies.

Sources:
- [PreP-OCR: A Complete Pipeline for Document Image Restoration](https://arxiv.org/html/2505.20429v1)
- [2024 review of OCR tools - Reddit Discussion](https://www.reddit.com/r/computervision/comments/1ctf0jh/2024_review_of_ocr_tools_extracting_text_from/)
- [Effective Data Augmentation for OCR - Towards Data Science](https://towardsdatascience.com/effective-data-augmentation-for-ocr-8013080aa9fa/)
- [Printed document layout analysis and OCR - Nature](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-025-07439-y)
- [7 Best Open-Source OCR Models 2025](https://www.e2enetworks.com/blog/complete-guide-open-source-ocr-models-2025)
- [Building Deep Learning-Based OCR Model](https://neptune.ai/blog/building-deep-learning-based-ocr-model)
- [Parallel Data Augmentation for Low Resource OCR](https://arxiv.org/html/2510.13211)

input: <web-search mcp-server="ydc-server">Find current information about: 한국 정부사이트 PDF 다운로드 curl SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL 해결 2026</web-search>
output:
Based on the search results, I found relevant information about resolving SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL issues when downloading PDFs from Korean government websites using curl. Here's what I discovered:

## Solutions for SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL with curl and Korean Government Sites

### Common Causes
The SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL error typically occurs when:
- SSL certificate verification fails
- The client cannot verify the server's certificate
- There are certificate chain issues
- Outdated SSL/TLS protocols are in use

### Solutions for curl

**Method 1: Disable SSL verification for specific command**
```bash
curl --insecure -O https://www.gov-site.kr/file.pdf
# or using short option
curl -k -O https://www.gov-site.kr/file.pdf
```

**Method 2: Configure curl globally via .curlrc**
```bash
echo "insecure" > ~/.curlrc
```

This creates a configuration file that tells curl to skip certificate verification for all requests.

### Solutions for Other Tools

**For wget:**
```bash
wget --no-check-certificate https://gov-site.kr/file.pdf
# or configure globally
echo "check-certificate = off" >> ~/.wgetrc
```

**For git operations:**
```bash
git config --global http.sslVerify false
```

### Best Practices (According to 2026 Guidelines)

According to the Korean government site error resolution guide from 2026:

1. **Network connectivity check** - Verify your internet connection is stable
2. **Clear browser cache/cookies** - Remove cached SSL certificates
3. **Update certificates** - Ensure your system's CA certificates are up to date
4. **Try with proper CA certificate** - If possible, install the government site's CA certificate:
   ```bash
   /opt/gitlab/embedded/bin/openssl s_client -connect gov-site.kr:443
   ```

### Important Security Note
Disabling SSL verification (`--insecure` or `-k`) should only be used temporarily for troubleshooting. It exposes you to man-in-the-middle attacks. The proper solution is to:

1. Install the required CA certificate in your system's trusted certificate store
2. Update your system's CA bundle
3. Ensure the government website is using valid, up-to-date certificates

### For System-Wide Certificate Trust
```bash
# Copy the certificate to trusted location
sudo cp gov-ca-cert.crt /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/
# Update CA trust (RHEL/CentOS)
sudo update-ca-trust
# Or for Debian/Ubuntu
sudo update-ca-certificates
```

Sources:
- [정부24 오류 해결 가이드 5단계(2026)-인증서, 접속 오류 한 번에 끝내기](https://myemotionbank.com/gov24-error-resolution-guide)
- [개발툴 SSL인증서 오류 해결하는 linux 명령 설정 모음](https://couplewith.tistory.com/494)
- [SSL 문제 해결 | GitLab 공식 기술 문서 한글판](https://gitlab-docs.infograb.net/omnibus/settings/ssl/ssl_troubleshooting.html)
- ["OpenSSL SSL_read: SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL" with OpenSSL ≥ 3.2 + old servers](https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/17471)

input: <web-search mcp-server="ydc-server">How do I find information about: pendlay row deficit tutorial youtube 2026?</web-search>
output:
I found several YouTube tutorials and resources about deficit Pendlay rows. Here are the most relevant results:

**YouTube Tutorials:**

1. **[Exercise Tutorial - Deficit Pendlay Row](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b0NDZ2Kh1Jc)** - A dedicated tutorial on the deficit Pendlay row technique (from December 2021)

2. **[How To: Deficit Pendlay Row](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KWwsiwSUdfQ)** - Another instructional video on performing deficit Pendlay rows (from January 2025)

3. **[Pendlay Deficit Barbell Rows](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/p0qrd5W0xDU)** - A YouTube Short demonstrating the exercise (from April 2025)

4. **[Jeff Nippard shows the Deficit Pendlay Row - The ULTIMATE Back...](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/Uc8Dw1V8gaE)** - Jeff Nippard's demonstration of the deficit Pendlay row (from June 2025)

5. **[Deficit Pendlay Rows](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/9zo9zuHoo9Q)** - Another YouTube Short tutorial (from June 2024)

6. **[Exercise Tutorial - Snatch Grip Deficit Pendlay Row](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H4jTdbwTWQs)** - A variation using snatch grip (from February 2022)

**Additional Resources:**

- **[BarBend Guide](https://barbend.com/pendlay-row/)** - Comprehensive written guide on Pendlay rows for back development
- **[Fitness Volt Guide](https://fitnessvolt.com/deficit-pendlay-rows-guide/)** - Complete guide covering technique, benefits, programming, and variations
- **Reddit Discussions** - Form check threads and discussions about the exercise

The deficit Pendlay row is a variation where you stand on an elevated platform to increase the range of motion, making it more challenging for back development.

Sources:
- [Exercise Tutorial - Deficit Pendlay Row - YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b0NDZ2Kh1Jc)
- [How To: Deficit Pendlay Row - YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KWwsiwSUdfQ)
- [Jeff Nippard shows the Deficit Pendlay Row - YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/Uc8Dw1V8gaE)
- [Pendlay Deficit Barbell Rows - YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/p0qrd5W0xDU)
- [How to Do the Pendlay Row - BarBend](https://barbend.com/pendlay-row/)
- [Deficit Pendlay Rows Guide - Fitness Volt](https://fitnessvolt.com/deficit-pendlay-rows-guide/)

input: <web-search mcp-server="ydc-server">Find current information about: CFTC commitments of traders current week report 2025 download txt file</web-search>
output:
Based on the CFTC website, I found the information you need about downloading the Commitments of Traders reports in text format. Here's what I found:

## CFTC Commitments of Traders (COT) Reports - TXT File Downloads

The CFTC publishes weekly COT reports every **Friday at 3:30 PM Eastern Time**, based on data from the previous **Tuesday**.

### Current Week Report Downloads (TXT/CSV Format)

The CFTC provides comma-delimited text files that you can download directly:

**Disaggregated Reports:**
- **Futures-Only**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/f_disagg.txt
- **Futures and Options Combined**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/c_disagg.txt

**Traders in Financial Futures:**
- **Futures-Only**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/FinFutWk.txt
- **Futures and Options Combined**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/FinComWk.txt

**Legacy Reports:**
- **Futures-Only**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deafut.txt
- **Options and Futures Combined**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deacom.txt

**Supplemental Commodity Index Report:**
- https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deacit.txt

### Additional Options

You can also access the data through:
- **Public Reporting Environment**: https://publicreporting.cftc.gov/stories/s/r4w3-av2u (allows customization and export to CSV, TSV, XML, RDF, RSS formats)
- **Email Notifications**: Sign up at https://service.govdelivery.com/accounts/USCFTC/subscriber/new to get notified when new reports are released

The most recent report available is dated **March 18, 2025** according to the website.

Sources:
- [Commitments of Traders | CFTC](https://www.cftc.gov/MarketReports/CommitmentsofTraders/index.htm)

## CFTC Commitments of Traders (COT) Reports - TXT File Downloads

The CFTC publishes weekly COT reports every **Friday at 3:30 PM Eastern Time**, based on data from the previous **Tuesday**.

### Current Week Report Downloads (TXT/CSV Format)

The CFTC provides comma-delimited text files that you can download directly:

**Disaggregated Reports:**
- **Futures-Only**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/f_disagg.txt
- **Futures and Options Combined**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/c_disagg.txt

**Traders in Financial Futures:**
- **Futures-Only**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/FinFutWk.txt
- **Futures and Options Combined**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/FinComWk.txt

**Legacy Reports:**
- **Futures-Only**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deafut.txt
- **Options and Futures Combined**: https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deacom.txt

**Supplemental Commodity Index Report:**
- https://www.cftc.gov/dea/newcot/deacit.txt

### Additional Options

You can also access the data through:
- **Public Reporting Environment**: https://publicreporting.cftc.gov/stories/s/r4w3-av2u (allows customization and export to CSV, TSV, XML, RDF, RSS formats)
- **Email Notifications**: Sign up at https://service.govdelivery.com/accounts/USCFTC/subscriber/new to get notified when new reports are released

The most recent report available is dated **March 18, 2025** according to the website.

Sources:
- [Commitments of Traders | CFTC](https://www.cftc.gov/MarketReports/CommitmentsofTraders/index.htm)
